title: Word Pairs Quiz
description: Match words that naturally go together!

questions.question: Which word naturally pairs with 'bread' in a common English expression?
questions.explanation: 'Bread and butter' is one of the most common word pairs in English, referring both to the food and metaphorically to one's livelihood or basic source of income.

questions.question: Complete the common pair: 'salt and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Salt and pepper' is an inseparable word pair. These two seasonings have been paired together for centuries and the phrase is also used to describe a mix of black and gray hair.

questions.question: Which word completes the pair: 'trial and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Trial and error' is a common word pair meaning a method of reaching a solution by trying various means and noting failures. It has been used in English since the 1800s.

questions.question: Complete the word pair: 'pros and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Pros and cons' is a standard word pair used when weighing advantages and disadvantages. It comes from the Latin 'pro et contra' meaning 'for and against.'

questions.question: Which word pairs with 'black' in a common expression about injury?
questions.explanation: 'Black and blue' is a common word pair describing the colors of a bruise. It has been used in English since at least the 13th century.

questions.question: Complete the pair: 'aches and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Aches and pains' is a common word pair referring to various minor physical discomforts. The two words reinforce each other's meaning.

questions.question: Which word completes this pair: 'wear and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Wear and tear' refers to damage that naturally occurs from ordinary use over time. It is commonly used in legal and insurance contexts.

questions.question: Complete the word pair: 'nook and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Nook and cranny' means every part or aspect of a place. A nook is a corner or recess, while a cranny is a small narrow opening or crack.

questions.question: Which word pairs with 'hue' in a common expression?
questions.explanation: 'Hue and cry' is a word pair meaning a loud public outcry. It originated in Anglo-Norman law, where it referred to the call for the pursuit of a criminal.

questions.question: Complete the pair: 'part and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Part and parcel' means an essential or integral component of something. The word 'parcel' here has the older meaning of 'part,' so the phrase is almost a redundancy for emphasis.

questions.question: Which word completes: 'wax and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Wax and wane' means to increase and decrease. Originally used to describe the phases of the moon, it now describes anything that fluctuates over time.

questions.question: Complete the pair: 'flotsam and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Flotsam and jetsam' originally referred to maritime law: flotsam is wreckage found floating, while jetsam is cargo deliberately thrown overboard. Together they mean odds and ends or discarded items.

questions.question: Which word pairs with 'beck' in an old English expression?
questions.explanation: 'Beck and call' means ready to obey someone's orders immediately. 'Beck' is an archaic word meaning a gesture of command, essentially a shortened form of 'beckon.'

questions.question: Complete the word pair: 'vim and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Vim and vigor' means energy and enthusiasm. 'Vim' comes from the Latin 'vis' meaning force or energy, while 'vigor' comes from the Latin 'vigere' meaning to thrive.

questions.question: Which word completes: 'kith and ___'?
questions.explanation: 'Kith and kin' means friends and relatives. 'Kith' is an Old English word meaning acquaintances or friends, while 'kin' means family or relatives.
